Node.definition: = period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
= month, equivalent to period March/April; ► post exilic
= man, better known as Artaxerxes I; ◄ son of Ahasuerus (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ) (Xerxes I); ► king of Persia (פָּרַס) time of Ezra (עֶזְרָא) and Nehemiah (נְחֶמְיָה)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex

Node.gloss: to take up|to lift up|to carry
Node.definition: literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= state in which humans experience an emotion of sadness, often visible in their facial expression

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= state in which humans experience an emotion of sadness, often visible in their facial expression
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

Node.gloss: to be, become weak|to be, become powerless|to be sick|to be injured
Node.definition: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= set of particles marking an object or event as a subset of a larger group which has been singled out from among the rest
literally: badness of heart; hence: = state in which humans experience an emotion of sadness, often visible in their facial expression
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

Node.gloss: to be alive|to become alive|to live
Node.definition: = to be alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
literally: (one's) face is bad; hence: = state in which humans feel distressed or miserable about a particular situation, which shows on their face
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
literally: house (of an object); hence: = a place that is associated with a certain class people that live there, or objects that are found there

= place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness
= indirect male progenitor
= state in which buildings and towns have been totally destroyed, ► to the extent that nobody can live there anymore
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= state in which humans experience the desire to attain a certain status or condition and do what is needed to make this a reality
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state in which humans or deities consider a matter or an activity morally and/or ethically right

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness
= indirect male progenitor
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= wife of a king
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity
relational indicating a location in the direct vicinity of the point of reference
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

= reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive
= the action by which a person moves or travels from one place to another

= reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
= state in which humans or deities consider a matter or an activity morally and/or ethically right
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
= specific moment in time that has been decided for a certain event to take place

= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= written document; ► composed by government official and used to communicate instructions or information to other people
= large body of flowing water ◄ located in Mesopotamia
= a linker indicating that one proposition is the purpose or result or another
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= written document; ► composed by government official and used to communicate instructions or information to other people
= man; ► forest guard; after exile

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= location for growing trees
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a complex of buildings in Jerusalem, including the temple area
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= large body of flowing water ◄ located in Mesopotamia

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= written document; ► composed by government official and used to communicate instructions or information to other people

= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

= an organized military force equipped for fighting on land; this term denotes primarily the foot soldiers, though it can also be used to refer to the entire fighting force, including chariots and horsemen
= soldier riding a horse
= man; ◄ from Beth Horon (בֵּית חֹורֹון) ► adversary of Nehemiah (נְחֶמְיָה)
= inhabitant of Beth Horon (בֵּית חֹורֹון)
= man; ◄ Ammonite (עַמֹּונִי) ► official opposed to Nehemiah (נְחֶמְיָה) leadership

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= inhabitant of Ammon (עַמֹּון)

literally: to be wrong or bad (to someone); hence = state in which certain actions or patterns of behavior are considered bad or evil by (other) humans or deities, ► which often provokes them to anger
= condition in which a person is angry or distressed about a particular situation
= state in which an event has a high intensity
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= state in which humans experience the desire to attain a certain status or condition and do what is needed to make this a reality
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= state in which a countable entity is three in number
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= small quantity of objects or substance
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a donkey (חֲמֹור) or a horse (סוּס) or in a chariot (מֶרְכָּבָה)

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart

= a gate ◄ in Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) ► where towers were built in the time of king Uzziah (עֻזִּיָּהוּ)
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= spring; ◄ outside of gate of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם)
= one of the gates of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם)
= action by which humans have a close and intent look at something to verify its quality

= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to break|to breach|to make breaches|to cut
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make one or more large holes in a wall, hedge, or in the ground; ► with the purpose of entering through those holes or of making the area within it vulnerable; ≈ to have a town with a breached wall is also regarded as a deep humiliation
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= one of the gates of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) in the days of Nehemiah (נְחֶמְיָה)
= relatively large reservoir ◄ dug by human hands ► to collect water; place where many public activities take place
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= general term for any animal that has been domesticated; ≈ considered part of someone's wealth

= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= action by which humans have a close and intent look at something to verify its quality

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which humans stop moving into a certain direction and start moving back into the direction they came from
= name of gate of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם)
= a gate ◄ in Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) ► where towers were built in the time of king Uzziah (עֻזִּיָּהוּ)
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
= a person of authority
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= person; ◄ belonging to the social class of the nobility ► and therefore often found in a position of authority; ≈ usually treated with respect
= a person of authority
= what remains in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way; used for humans, animals, plants, and inanimate objects

= state in which buildings and towns have been totally destroyed, ► to the extent that nobody can live there anymore

= state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

literally: to strengthen (someone's) hands; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause other humans to be mentally strong able to deal with issues relating to their daily work and to morals and ethics
literally: to strengthen (someone's) hands; hence: = causative action by which human help other humans to find the courage to perform a certain event
= man; ◄ from Beth Horon (בֵּית חֹורֹון) ► adversary of Nehemiah (נְחֶמְיָה)
= inhabitant of Beth Horon (בֵּית חֹורֹון)
= man; ◄ Ammonite (עַמֹּונִי) ► official opposed to Nehemiah (נְחֶמְיָה) leadership

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= inhabitant of Ammon (עַמֹּון)
= man, also known as Gashmu (גַּשְׁמוּ) ◄ Arab (עַרְבִי) ► opponent of Nehemiah (נְחֶמְיָה) after exile
= inhabitant of Arabia (עֲרַב)
only used in poetry; = action by which humans or deities express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures

Node.gloss: to despise|to disdain|to scorn|to consider (something) beneath (oneself)
Node.definition: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse

Node.gloss: to respond|to bring back word|to report
Node.definition: literally: to bring back word; hence: = action by which humans respond to (other) humans or deities in a direct conversation

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: to make successful|to give success|to make prosper
Node.definition: = causative action by which a deity assists or helps a human complete a task with the desired outcome
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= relationship among humans or between humans and a certain location
= something that one considers one's rightful due
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
